prompt.role: You are a senior frontend developer specializing in React, Material-UI, and modern web application development with expertise in component architecture and responsive design.

task.title: Frontend Components
task.description: Create basic frontend structure and components for the application using React 18, Material-UI 5, and React Router 6. Implement package configuration with all necessary dependencies, create main App component with routing and theming, and build 8 core UI components including Header, Footer, HomePage, ProductList, ProductDetail, Cart, Login, and Register pages with consistent Material-UI styling and navigation.

technical_specifications.spec: Use React 18.2.0 with functional components and hooks (no class components)
Use Material-UI 5.14.0 for all UI components and styling
Use React Router 6.14.2 for client-side routing
Use axios 1.4.0 for future API integration (placeholder usage)
Configure Material-UI theme with primary color #1976d2 and secondary #dc004e
Create 8 component files: Header, Footer, HomePage, ProductList, ProductDetail, Cart, Login, Register
Use Material-UI components exclusively (AppBar, Card, Grid, TextField, Button, etc.)
Include ThemeProvider and CssBaseline for consistent styling
Components should be placeholders with sample data, not connected to backend
Use react-scripts 5.0.1 for build tooling and development server
Responsive design using Material-UI's Grid system

step.details:
Create the following directory structure: frontend/ ├── package.json ├── src/ │ ├── App.js │ └── components/ │ ├── Header.js │ ├── Footer.js │ ├── HomePage.js │ ├── ProductList.js │ ├── ProductDetail.js │ ├── Cart.js │ ├── Login.js │ └── Register.js
Ensure all directories exist before creating files within them.

Create frontend/package.json with exact content specified in task.txt.
Key dependencies: - react & react-dom: ^18.2.0 (core React framework) - react-router-dom: ^6.14.2 (routing) - axios: ^1.4.0 (HTTP client for future API integration) - @mui/material: ^5.14.0 (Material-UI components) - @mui/icons-material: ^5.14.0 (Material-UI icons) - @emotion/react & @emotion/styled: ^11.11.1 (CSS-in-JS for Material-UI)
Dev dependencies: - react-scripts: 5.0.1 (build tooling)
Scripts: - start: Launches development server on port 3000 - build: Creates production build - test: Runs tests - eject: Ejects from Create React App (not recommended for this project)
The package.json must be valid JSON with proper formatting. Use exact version numbers as specified to ensure compatibility.

step.action: Create App.js with routing and theming
step.details:
Create frontend/src/App.js as the main application component.
Structure: 1. Imports: - React from 'react' - BrowserRouter (as Router), Routes, Route from 'react-router-dom' - ThemeProvider, createTheme from '@mui/material/styles' - CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline' - All 8 component files (Header, Footer, HomePage, etc.)
2. Theme configuration: const theme = createTheme({ palette: { primary: { main: '#1976d2' }, secondary: { main: '#dc004e' } } });
3. Component structure: - ThemeProvider wraps everything with theme prop - CssBaseline for CSS reset - Router (BrowserRouter) for routing - Header component (outside Routes, always visible) - main element with Routes inside - Define 6 routes with path and element props - Footer component (outside Routes, always visible)
4. Routes: - / → HomePage - /products → ProductList - /products/:id → ProductDetail - /cart → Cart - /login → Login - /register → Register
5. Export default App
The main content should have padding and minimum height to keep footer at bottom.

Create frontend/src/components/Header.js
Use Material-UI AppBar component with: - Toolbar containing: * Typography for site title "E-Commerce Demo" (flexGrow: 1) * Link to home page (/) on title * Button linking to /products * IconButton with ShoppingCartIcon and Badge (cart item count) * Link to /cart on cart icon * Button for Login/Logout * Link to /login on button
The component should: - Use AppBar with position="static" - Import Link from react-router-dom for navigation - Use placeholder values for isLoggedIn (false) and cartItemCount (0) - Style links to remove default link styling
Export as default.

Create frontend/src/components/Footer.js
Simple footer using Material-UI: - Box component as footer container - bgcolor: 'background.paper' - py: 2 (vertical padding) - mt: 'auto' (push to bottom) - Container inside Box - Typography for copyright text - Display current year using new Date().getFullYear() - Center aligned text - "© {year} Parallel Task Execution Test"
Export as default.

Create frontend/src/components/HomePage.js
Landing page with: - Container with maxWidth="md" - Box with my: 4, textAlign: 'center' - Typography variant="h3" for main heading "Welcome to Our Store" - Typography variant="h5" for subheading "Browse our catalog of products" - Button variant="contained" color="primary" size="large" - Button links to /products - Button text: "Shop Now"
Use Link from react-router-dom for navigation.
Export as default.

Create these four components as simpler placeholders:
1. ProductDetail.js: - Use useParams() from react-router-dom to get id - Display heading with product ID - "Back to Products" link to /products - Use Container, Typography
2. Cart.js: - Simple container - "Shopping Cart" heading - Placeholder message or empty cart display - Use Container, Typography
3. Login.js: - Container with Box - "Login" heading - TextField for email (type="email") - TextField for password (type="password") - Login Button - Link to /register: "Don't have an account? Register" - Use Container, Box, TextField, Button, Typography
4. Register.js: - Similar to Login but with: - "Register" heading - TextField for username - TextField for email - TextField for password - Register Button - Link to /login: "Already have an account? Login"
All components should export as default.

Run validation checks:
1. File structure check: ls -la frontend/package.json ls -la frontend/src/App.js ls -la frontend/src/components/
Confirm all 9 files exist (1 package.json, 1 App.js, 8 components).
2. Install dependencies: cd frontend && npm install
Must complete without errors. Verify node_modules/ is created and package-lock.json is generated.
3. Start development server: cd frontend && npm start
Server should start on http://localhost:3000 and automatically open browser. Check for "Compiled successfully" message.
4. Browser verification: - Open http://localhost:3000 - Check that home page loads - Verify Material-UI styling is applied - Check navigation bar and footer appear - Click navigation links to test routing - Open browser console, verify no errors
Do not mark complete if any validation step fails. Fix issues and re-validate.

prompt.test_strategy:
Validation approach for frontend components:
1. File Structure Verification: - Confirm frontend/ directory exists - Verify package.json in frontend/ - Check src/App.js exists - Verify components/ directory with all 8 files
2. Dependency Check: - Review package.json for all required dependencies - Verify correct version numbers - Check scripts are properly defined
3. Installation Testing: - Run npm install in frontend/ directory - Verify successful completion - Check node_modules/ created - Verify package-lock.json generated
4. Build System Testing: - Run npm start - Verify server starts on port 3000 - Check for "Compiled successfully" message - Verify browser opens automatically
5. Component Rendering: - Open http://localhost:3000 - Verify home page displays - Check Material-UI styling is visible - Confirm header and footer appear - Verify no console errors
6. Routing Testing: - Click navigation links (Products, Cart, Login) - Verify each route displays correct component - Check URL updates properly - Test browser back/forward buttons - Test direct URL navigation
7. Component Functionality: - HomePage: Check heading and Shop Now button - ProductList: Verify product grid with cards - ProductDetail: Check URL parameter handling - Cart: Verify cart page renders - Login: Check form fields present - Register: Verify registration form
8. Material-UI Integration: - Verify theme colors are applied - Check AppBar styling - Confirm Card components styled correctly - Verify Button colors match theme - Check responsive Grid layout
9. Code Quality: - Review that all components are functional (not class) - Verify proper imports at top of files - Check exports at bottom - Confirm no unused imports
10. Commands to execute: cd frontend && npm install cd frontend && npm start curl http://localhost:3000 # Manual browser testing for navigation
prompt.instructions:
You are implementing Task 6: Frontend Components for a parallel task execution test project.
CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS: - This is a Level 0 task with NO dependencies - proceed immediately - Create exactly the files specified in the implementation steps - Use exact dependency versions specified - Follow Create React App conventions with react-scripts - Use functional components with hooks, NOT class components - This is a test project - components have placeholder data and functionality
IMPLEMENTATION APPROACH: 1. Create frontend directory structure 2. Create package.json with all dependencies 3. Create App.js with routing and theming 4. Create all 8 component files 5. Validate with npm install and npm start
QUALITY STANDARDS: - All components must be functional components - Use Material-UI components exclusively for UI - Follow React Router 6 patterns (useParams, Link, etc.) - Configure theme with specified colors - Include CssBaseline for CSS reset - Use responsive Grid layout - Consistent component structure and naming - Proper imports and exports
DEPENDENCY REQUIREMENTS: - React 18.2.0 (latest stable) - Material-UI 5.14.0 (comprehensive component library) - React Router 6.14.2 (modern routing with hooks) - Exact versions specified to ensure compatibility - react-scripts handles build tooling
COMPONENT REQUIREMENTS: - Header: AppBar with navigation and cart badge - Footer: Simple copyright footer - HomePage: Welcome page with call-to-action - ProductList: Grid of product cards with placeholder data - ProductDetail: Dynamic route with useParams - Cart: Placeholder cart page - Login: Form with email and password fields - Register: Form with username, email, password fields
ROUTING STRUCTURE: - Use BrowserRouter (Router) - Define Routes with Route components - Six routes: /, /products, /products/:id, /cart, /login, /register - Use Link for navigation (not anchor tags) - Header and Footer outside Routes (always visible)
STYLING APPROACH: - Material-UI provides all styling - Custom theme with primary/secondary colors - ThemeProvider wraps entire app - CssBaseline normalizes CSS - Responsive Grid for layouts - sx prop for inline styles where needed
PLACEHOLDER FUNCTIONALITY: - Components don't connect to backend (yet) - ProductList has hardcoded sample data - Authentication components don't submit to API - Cart doesn't persist data - This is intentional for test project
SUCCESS DEFINITION: You have completed this task successfully when: 1. All files created with correct content 2. package.json has all dependencies 3. npm install completes successfully 4. npm start launches without errors 5. Application loads in browser 6. All navigation works correctly 7. Material-UI styling is visible 8. No console errors 9. Ready for Task 7 integration testing
VALIDATION CHECKLIST: Before marking complete, verify: - [ ] 9 files created: package.json, App.js, 8 components - [ ] All dependencies with correct versions - [ ] npm install succeeds - [ ] npm start succeeds - [ ] Browser shows application - [ ] Navigation works for all routes - [ ] Material-UI theme applied - [ ] No console errors - [ ] All components render correctly
DO NOT: - Use class components - Add backend API integration - Add state management libraries - Use custom CSS files (Material-UI only) - Add extra dependencies beyond specification - Skip validation steps
DO: - Use functional components with hooks - Use Material-UI components exclusively - Follow React Router 6 patterns - Create placeholder components as specified - Test thoroughly before marking complete - Ensure all navigation works
